intro: Brachyscome basaltica var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. This variant is distinguished by its slender stems and small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a resilient addition to native gardens.
